data.title: TV Shows Starring Doon Mackichan
data.meta_description: Lists the series featuring Doon Mackichan. These shows include Good Omens, Plebs, Toast of London, Two Doors Down, Smack the Pony, Stressed Eric, Taking the Flak, The Strangerers and The Duchess

Known for

TV Series Starring Doon Mackichan

The Duchess

Netflix, 2020 Cancelled/Ended | Comedy, Drama | ► Trailer

Rating: 53.9/5

The Duchess follows the powerful and problematic choices of a fashionably disruptive single mom living in London. Her daughter, Olive, is her greatest love so she debates a second child with her greatest enemy - Olive's dad. Can two wrongs make another right?

Good Omens

Prime Video, 2019 Running | Comedy, Drama, Fantasy | ► Trailer

Rating: 54.4/5

According to The Nice and Accurate Prophecies of Agnes Nutter, Witch (the world's only completely accurate book of prophecies), the world will end on a Saturday. Next Saturday, in fact. Just before dinner. So the armies of Good and Evil are amassing, Atlantis is rising, tempers are flaring. Everything appears to be going according to Divine Plan. Except Aziraphale, a somewhat fussy angel, and Crowley, a fast-living demon - both of whom have lived among Earth's mortals since The Beginning and have grown rather fond of the lifestyle - are not actually looking forward to the coming war. And someone seems to have misplaced the Antichrist...

Two Doors Down

BBC Two, 2016 Running | Comedy | ► Trailer

Rating: 54.2/5

Comedy centred around a couple and their insufferable neighbours.

Plebs

ITV2, 2013 Cancelled/Ended | Comedy | ► Trailer

Rating: 54.3/5

This is a comedy series set in Ancient Rome. Not likely to be immortalized in history, Marcus, Stylax and Grumio are just everyday plebs. The series follows three desperate young men from the suburbs as they attempt to get laid, keep their jobs and climb the social ladder in Ancient Rome.

Toast of London

Channel 4, 2013 Cancelled/Ended | Comedy | ► Trailer

Rating: 53.8/5

A sitcom which focuses on Steven Toast, a middle-aged actor who has a chequered past and spends more time dealing with his problems off stage rather than actually performing on it.

Taking the Flak

A team of journalists find out exactly how hard it is to report from a war zone - not just because of the perpetual danger but because of each other too.

The Strangerers

Sky 1, 2000 Cancelled/Ended | Comedy, Sci-Fi

Rating: 52.5/5

Two bumbling vegetable-based alien cadets find themselves helplessly stuck on Earth after losing their supervisor, while two argumentative government agents try to eliminate the alien threat.

Smack the Pony

Channel 4, 1999 Cancelled/Ended | Comedy, Sketch/Improv

Rating: 54/5

The stylish, original and uninhibited Emmy award-winning sketch show starring Fiona Allen, Doon Mackichan and Sally Phillips. Distinctly contemporary.

Stressed Eric

BBC Three, 1998 Cancelled/Ended | Comedy, Drama, Adult Cartoons, Animation

Rating: 53/5

Eric Feeble is a middle-class divorced father of two who resides in London, England. An average man, with a less than average life, Eric is endlessly at his wits end - stressed out with his family, coworkers, and his life in general. For starters, there's his children. His precocious daughter, Claire is allergic to everything, from peanuts to dolls and everything in between. Eric's toadish son, Brian, sticks everything into his mouth that he can get his hands on. The family's live-in au pair, Maria, is a drunken nymphomaniac with a bad habit of disappearing for days at a time. Eric's ex-wife, Liz, is a whiny psycho who's involved in every kind of "rights" act imaginable, from "animal rights" to "tree rights" to Buddhism. Just to make his oddball family dynamics look worse, the next door neighbours are the aptly named Perfects, who are wealthy and snobbish.
